page.title: 10COMPTON MANOR _ FARMS
page.content: FARMS:- HORSEBRIDGE, BROOK, PARK, HOME, LOWER ELDON. Bought by Sir Thomas Sopwith in 1953, At the time of purchase, the main emphasis on the estate was sport: Pheasants, trout from the Test, and horses. Now the estate has been re_organised into a commercial concern : it is mainly arable with one dairy herd of 150 cows. The present herd is milked by one man through a herring bone parlour. Home Farm, dated 1912, still shows the standings where the cows were tied and milked by hand. In the days of hand_milking, one man would milk about ten cows. In the last two years, six of the work_force from Compton Manor Farms have received "Long Service Awards" (25 years) presented to them at Romsey Agricultural Show.
